thing-type.label: ZMNKAD Qubino Luxy Smart Switch
thing-type.description: Qubino Luxy Smart Switch<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtThe Qubino LUXY Smart Switch is ideal for gentle illumination of any room, for visual and sound notifications, and for controlling various loads, using the built-in relay.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtManual inclusion is triggered by the following procedure: </p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtFull white needs to be active (c-button 2). The user can select it by quickly pressing the c-button2 once.</li&gt <li&gtWhen full white is enabled, press c-button3 and hold it for 5 seconds (while white is glowing, hold c-button3 for 5 seconds).</li&gt <li&gtAfter 5 seconds, the device starts flashing, with the following pattern: green 1 second on, 0.5 second off.</li&gt <li&gtOnce the device receives a nodeId or after 10 seconds, it stops flashing and turns green. </li&gt </ul&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtExclusion is triggered by the following procedure:</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtFull white needs to be active (c-button 2).</li&gt <li&gtWhen full white is enabled, press c-button3 and hold it for 5 seconds (while white is glowing hold c-button3 for 5 seconds).</li&gt <li&gtAfter 5 seconds, the device starts flashing with the following pattern: red 1 second on, 0.5 second off. </li&gt <li&gtOnce the device loses its nodeId or after 10 seconds, it stops flashing and turns red. </li&gt </ul&gt

parameter.name: config_3_1
parameter.label: 3: Turning off alarming
parameter.description: Turning off alarming<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtDefault value 1</p&gt <p&gt0 – only by z-wave command (basic set, switch multilevel set, switch multilevel start/stop level change, sound switch play tone, sound switch configuration, switch color set, switch color start/stop level change, notification report idle)</p&gt <p&gt1 – capacitive input or z-wave command (basic set, switch multilevel set, switch multilevel start/stop level change, sound switch play tone, sound switch configuration, switch color set, switch color start/stop level change, notification report idle)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_10_2
parameter.label: 10: Auto On timer
parameter.description: Auto On timer<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtDefines the time after which the device is turned to last known state.</p&gt <p&gtDefault value 0</p&gt <p&gt0 – disabled</p&gt <p&gt30 – 32535 = 30 – 32535 seconds after which the device turns on</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_11_2
parameter.label: 11: Auto Off timer
parameter.description: Auto Off timer<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtDefines the time after which the device is turned off.</p&gt <p&gtDefault value 0</p&gt <p&gt0 – disabled</p&gt <p&gt30 – 32535 = 30 – 32535 seconds after which the device turns off</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_12_2
parameter.label: 12: Auto On timer relay
parameter.description: Auto On timer relay<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtDefines the time after which the device's relay is turned to last known state.</p&gt <p&gtDefault value 0</p&gt <p&gt0 – disabled</p&gt <p&gt30 – 32535 = 30 – 32535 seconds after which the device turns on</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_13_2
parameter.label: 13: Auto Off timer relay
parameter.description: Auto Off timer relay<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtDefines the time after which the device's relay is turned off.</p&gt <p&gtDefault value 0</p&gt <p&gt0 – disabled</p&gt <p&gt30 – 32535 = 30 – 32535 seconds after which the device turns off</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_30_1
parameter.label: 30: Restore state on power failure
parameter.description: Restore state on power failure<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtDefault value 1</p&gt <p&gt1 – enabled (the device will restore state on power failure)</p&gt <p&gt0 – dissabled (the device will not restore state on power failure and will remain off)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_31_1
parameter.label: 31: Restore relay state on power failure
parameter.description: Restore relay state on power failure<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtDefault value 1</p&gt <p&gt1 – enabled (the device will restore state on power failure)</p&gt <p&gt0 – disabled (the device will not restore state on power failure and will remain off)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_40_1
parameter.label: 40: Power Consumption Reporting Threshold
parameter.description: Power Consumption Reporting Threshold<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtChoose by how much power consumption needs to increase or decrease to be reported. Values correspond to percentages so if 10 is set (by default), the device will report any power consumption changes of 10% or more compared to the last reading.</p&gt <p&gtValues (size is 1 byte dec):</p&gt <p&gtdefault value 10</p&gt <p&gt0 - Power consumption reporting disabled</p&gt <p&gt1 - 100 = 1% - 100% Power consumption reporting enabled. New value is reported only when Wattage in real time changes by more than the percentage value set in this parameter compared to the previous Wattage reading, starting at 1% (the lowest value possible).</p&gt <p&gtNOTE: Power consumption needs to increase or decrease by at least 1 Watt to be reported, REGARDLESS of percentage set in this parameter.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_42_2
parameter.label: 42: Power Consumption Threshold (time)
parameter.description: Power Consumption Threshold (time)<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSet value refers to the time interval with which power consumption in Watts is reported (0 – 32535 seconds). If 300 is entered (by default), energy consumption reports will be sent to the gateway (hub) every 300 seconds (or 5 minutes).</p&gt <p&gtdefault value 0</p&gt <p&gt0 - Power consumption reporting disabled</p&gt <p&gt30 - 32535 = 30 - 32535 seconds. Power consumption reporting enabled. Report is sent according to time interval (value) set here.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_70_2
parameter.label: 70: Overload safety switch
parameter.description: Overload safety switch<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe function allows for turning off the controlled device in case of exceeding the defined power for more than 5s. Controlled device can be turned back on by input I1 or sending a control frame.</p&gt <p&gtValues (size is 2 byte dec):</p&gt <p&gtdefault value 2300</p&gt <p&gt1 – 2300 = 1 W – 2300W</p&gt <p&gt0 = function not active</p&gt <p&gtⓘ NOTE: This functionality is not an overload safety protection, please check the technical specifications chapter for more details.</p&gt <p&gtIn case of overload the following message will be send towards the controller:</p&gt <p&gtCOMMAND_CLASS_NOTIFICATION_V5</p&gt <p&gtThe Alarm V1 type field set to 0x00</p&gt <p&gtNotification Type 0x08 and 0x08 (Overload detected)</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.label: 1: Lifeline
